abstract.text: Add support for racing wheel devices in macOS.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: For macOS apps that support racing wheel devices, follow these steps for your app:
If you distribute your app through the Mac App Store, add the
entitlement to your Xcode project.
To get a racing wheel controller object, register for the
(Swift) or
(Objective-C) and
(Swift) or
(Objective-C) notifications. Alternatively, check the
class property for the currently connected controllers.
To start receiving input from a racing wheel controller, invoke the
method. Then use the
method when you finish processing input.
To process the input, set callbacks for the specific racing wheel elements that you want to receive input from. For example, set the
property of the steering wheel and accelerator pedal elements. Get these elements using the
and
properties of the racing wheel’s
property, as in:
If you just want the latest value of the steering wheel, use the
property.
For games that poll for input, set the input buffer size using the
property. In each iteration of your game loop, repeatedly invoke the
method until the queue is empty and it returns

abstract.text: A Boolean value indicating whether your app may interact with USB devices.
A notification that posts after a racing wheel controller connects to the device.
A notification that posts after a racing wheel controller disconnects from the device.
Support hardware game controllers in your game.
An input object that provides absolute axis values.
The common properties of inputs that provide absolute values along an axis with a fixed origin.
The maximum number of input values that the queue stores.
An element that represents either a pattern or a sequential gear shift.
The Objective-C type for an input axis name.
The Objective-C type for the name of a directional pad.
The name for the left paddle input.
The name for the left paddle input.
The name for the right paddle input.
The name for the right paddle input.
The Objective-C type for an input switch name.
The common properties of inputs that provide values in unit coordinates.
The block that the profile calls when an element’s value changes.
An object that represents a physical racing wheel controller connected to a device.
Starts receiving events from the racing wheel.
The racing wheels connected to the device.
Stops receiving events from the racing wheel.
The physical input profile for the racing wheel.
A notification that posts after a racing wheel controller connects to the device.
A notification that posts after a racing wheel controller disconnects from the device.
A controller profile that supports a racing wheel.
Returns the next input state of the racing wheel from the queue.
The input for the wheel of a racing wheel controller.
The controller’s accelerator pedal element.
The controller’s wheel element.
The common properties of inputs that provide positions along an axis that are relative to the previous position.
The element that represents the wheel of a racing wheel controller.
The common properties of inputs that switch between two or more positions.
